pageContext.claim: “When George Steinbrenner died, like with the estate taxes, the estate paid nothing. And if he would have died like two weeks later, they would have paid 50 percent of the Yankees.”
pageContext.analysis: Steinbrenner died in 2010, when the estate tax was briefly repealed (but heavy capital gains taxes kicked in). But in 2011, as much as the first $10 million of an estate was exempt from taxation, and then a 35 percent rate was applied. So Trump is wrong to say the estate would have had to pay a 50 percent tax.
